prereq.p: Create a private key and a self signed certificate as explained in the Creating a Private Key and Self Signed Certificate.

step.cmd: Run MakeKeys at the command prompt using the -req option.

info.note: The <cert-request-file> must specify a name for the output certificate request file with .p10 extension.

stepxmp.codeblock: > makekeys -req -dname "CN=Symbian Foundation Developer O=Symbian Foundation C=GB" HelloWorld.key HelloWorld.cer HelloWorldreq.p10
stepxmp.p: Here, the -dname provides a simple distinguished name string to the MakeKeys tool. HelloWorld.key is the private key file and HelloWorld.cer is the public key self-signed certificate file that were created previously using MakeKeys. Helloworldreq.p10 is the name of the output certificate request file.
